summary:
The Security Council:

* Notes the model status-of-forces agreement shall apply provisionally to UNOCI pending a definitive agreement.
* Stresses the importance of implementing the Linas-Marcoussis Agreement, demanding parties fulfil their obligations to hold the Presidential election in 2005.
* Calls on parties to cooperate with UNOCI, guaranteeing safety, security, and freedom of movement for UN personnel.
* Reaffirms the need for the Government of National Reconciliation to implement disarmament, demobilization, and reintegration (DDR) programme.
* Urges the international community to support economic development in Côte d’Ivoire.
* Requests the Secretary-General to report regularly on the situation, implementation of the Linas-Marcoussis Agreement, and UNOCI's mandate.
* Renews authorization for French and ECOWAS forces until 4 April 2004.
* Authorizes French forces to support UNOCI for 12 months from 4 April 2004, to contribute to security, intervene in support of UNOCI, and protect civilians.
* Requests France to report periodically on its mandate in Côte d’Ivoire.
* Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
